    public abstract class EditDialog<E>
extends com.alee.laf.window.WebDialog<EditDialog<E>>
    This is a super class for all the editing dialogs.
    Author:
    Axel Berndt

      abstract E edit(E input)
      Open the editor dialog and edit the input object or create a new one (if input is null).
      protected void fillNameRefChooser(meico.mpm.elements.styles.GenericStyle style)
      This method takes the given style and puts all its defs' names into the nameRefChooser.
      protected void fullNameRefUpdate(java.lang.String styleType)
      Invoke this method in a map element dialog to 1. get the style that applies to the element's date, 2. fill the nameRefChooser with the style's def names 3. update the text color in the nameRef field according to whether the name is in the style or not.

      • makeContentPanel

        public abstract void makeContentPanel()
        This method must be implemented to create the real editing UI. Consider that the content panel's layout manager is of type GridBagLayout.

      • setMsmDate

        public void setMsmDate(double date)
        While this.date holds the date according to the performance's PPQ, this.msmDate holds the date according to the MSM's PPQ.
        Parameters:

      • addNameRef

        protected void addNameRef(java.lang.String title,
                          int gridBagRow,
                          boolean checkAgainstStyles)
        This is a prefabricated method to add name.ref input to the GUI.
        Parameters:
        title -
        gridBagRow -
        checkAgainstStyles - set true to activate automatic check if the name in this field exists in localStyle or globalStyle and set the text color accordingly.

      • makeNameRefCheckAgainstStyles

        private void makeNameRefCheckAgainstStyles()
        This adds functionality to the nameRef textfield. If its content changes it will automatically check against the localStyle and globalStyle if the name exists and color the text accordingly via method updateNameRefField().

      • updateNameRefField

        protected void updateNameRefField()
        format the nameRef text according to whether the name exists in the underlying style or not

      • fillNameRefChooser

        protected void fillNameRefChooser(meico.mpm.elements.styles.GenericStyle style)
        This method takes the given style and puts all its defs' names into the nameRefChooser.
        Parameters:
        style -

      • fullNameRefUpdate

        protected void fullNameRefUpdate(java.lang.String styleType)
        Invoke this method in a map element dialog to 1. get the style that applies to the element's date, 2. fill the nameRefChooser with the style's def names 3. update the text color in the nameRef field according to whether the name is in the style or not.
        Parameters:
        styleType - use the constants in class Mpm
